label: [.core] support JS hash naming in variable access
info: ## Hash naming Javascript supports array-like access to object variables: ``` key.key2["key-three-minus"] ``` which is the equivalent to ``` key.key2.key-three-minus ``` But since `-` is not allowed in variable names nor in keynames when using dot-notation, JS invented the array-like accessing of keynames with minus and other special characters. Since objects attributes can definitely contain minus & spaces & all sorts. ## Workaround Until this is implemented, the function 2 node provides a workaround by using Erlang code to access the map data directly.

name: function 1
func:
maps:put(req, 
#{cookies =>
[{<<"wsname">>,<<"none">>}],
params => #{},
uri => <<"http://red-erik.org/">>,
query => #{},body => <<>>,
headers =>
#{<<"accept">> =>
<<"text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8">>,
<<"accept-encoding">> =>
<<"gzip, deflate, br, zstd">>,
<<"accept-language">> =>
<<"en-GB,en;q=0.5">>,
<<"cookie">> =>
<<"wsname=none">>,
<<"dnt">> => <<"1">>,
<<"host">> =>
<<"red-erik.org">>,
<<"priority">> => <<"u=0, i">>,
<<"sec-fetch-dest">> =>
<<"document">>,
<<"sec-fetch-mode">> =>
<<"navigate">>,
<<"sec-fetch-site">> =>
<<"cross-site">>,
<<"server">> => <<"Heroku">>,
<<"upgrade-insecure-requests">> =>
<<"1">>,
<<"user-agent">> =>
<<"Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0">>,
<<"via">> =>
<<"2.0 heroku-router">>,
<<"x-forwarded-for">> =>
<<"46.142.30.68">>,
<<"x-forwarded-port">> =>
<<"443">>,
<<"x-forwarded-proto">> =>
<<"https">>,
<<"x-request-id">> =>
<<"f0c743fc-00d0-b6d3-360c-07a4b99cfc88">>,
<<"x-request-start">> =>
<<"1749713466544">>},
method => <<"GET">>,
para1 => #{ <<"para2">> => #{ <<"para3">> => #{ <<"para4">> => <<"hwllo">> } } },
<<"para2">> => #{ <<"para2">> => #{ <<"para3">> => #{ <<"para4">> => <<"hwllo">> } } },
url => <<"/">>},
Msg)

name: function 2
func:
case maps:find(req, Msg) of
   {ok, D} ->
       case maps:find(headers, D) of 
          {ok, H} ->
            case maps:find(<<"x-forwarded-proto">>,H) of  
                {ok, S} ->
                    maps:put(schema, S, Msg);
                _ -> 
                    Msg
            end;
           _ ->
            Msg
        end;
    _ ->
      Msg
end
